intro: Habranthus sanavirone, commonly known as the Sanavirone bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue and violet. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are broad and lanceolate, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
